newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mixed on OTC market.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mixed on OTC market.

text.p: Following is the closing report for Croatia's over-the counter securities market in Varazdin, including its outpost Osijek, for Thursday, October 3.
* Of thirteen active issues six rose, two fell, five remained flat
* 10-stock VIN index up 1.55 percent to 7,886 points.
* Most active hotelier Suncani Hvar was down 0.79 percent to 12.60 marks a share on volume of 1,096.
* Confectioner Kras was the biggest loser, down 5.88 pct to 160 marks on volume of 225 shares.
* Biggest gainer hotelier Jadranturist Rovinj, up 63.93 percent to 100 marks with 51 shares sold, followed by:
* Hotelier Arenaturist Pula, up 25.0 pct to 50 marks a share on volume of 439 units.
* Hotelier Rivijera Porec, up 11.11 pct to 50 marks a share on volume on 728.
* Adriatic pipeline operator Jadranski Naftovod Zagreb was up 3.45 pct a share to 600 kuna with 10 shares sold.
* Hotelier Plava Laguna Porec, up 1.89 pct to 270 marks on volume of 62 shares.
* Hotelier Istraturist Umag, up 1.79 pct to 57 marks on volume of 631. In Osijek it was flat at 56 marks with 409 shares sold.
- Croatia Banka at 38 marks with 108 shares sold.
- Cable maker Elka Zagreb at 55 marks with 146 shares sold.
- Textile firm Varteks at 19.50 marks with 280 shares sold.
- Food processor Podravka at 75 marks with 1,069 units sold in Varazdin and 15 in Osijek.
- Hotelier Haludovo traded at 35 marks on volume of 177 shares.
